title: Andy Ruiz Jr believes 'slimmer' Anthony Joshua will target points victory in rematch
text:
Andy Ruiz Jr has predicted that Anthony Joshua will look to use his 'slimmer' frame to win on points in the British star's bid for redemption against the unified champion.

Joshua has been seen boasting a trimmer physique in recent weeks ahead of the rematch in Saudi Arabia on December 7.

But the 30-year-old Mexican-American puncher believes that his opponent has unintentionally revealed his tactic for 'Clash on the Dunes', and is prepared for a gruelling encounter in the ring.

Andy Ruiz Jr believes that Anthony Joshua will target a points victory in the pair's rematch

He said: 'He looks a little slimmer, but I don't think that's going to do any different.

'He's going to try and win by points - especially since he's going to be running around.

'My job is to cut the ring, and that's exactly what we've been training for.

'I don't really worry about what he's doing, you know. We have to worry about what we're doing. He has to train hard.

'I feel that he has more pressure than I do. I just have to do what I have to do, and just let my hands go and focus.

The Mexican-American underdog showed his lightning hand speed at a public workout

Ruiz once again demonstrated the formidable skill set that had dethroned Joshua in June

The 30-year-old smashed the pads with trainer Manny Robles in a clip posted on his Instagram

'He even said at one of the press conferences, he said that he was gonna be boxing around.

'He kinda told me his strategy, but whatever he does we're gonna do the best we can to do our thing.'

Ruiz demonstrated the formidable skill set that had seen him shock Joshua in the pair's original bout in a public workout in San Diego on Sunday.

Both fighters have lost bulk ahead of December's highly-anticipated bout in Saudi Arabia

The WBA, IBF and WBO champion had knocked Joshua to the canvas four times in New York earlier this year, and has vowed to prove that his dethroning of the heavyweight was no coincidence.

The session was made up of Ruiz smashing the pads with trainer Manny Robles, and social media users soon warned Joshua that he may face another major setback during December's highly-anticipated showdown.

Despite the majority of attention being focused on Joshua's slimmer frame, Ruiz has also notably lost bulk after revealing that he had hoped to drop 10lbs to improve agility for his title defence.
description: The 30-year-old Mexican-American puncher believes that his opponent has unintentionally revealed his tactic for 'Clash on the Dunes', and is prepared for a gruelling encounter in the ring.
